strings.Value: "Who are you?"
"What are you doing here?"
"The fog looks visible enough to me."
"I should probably go."
"My 'rival'? Do you mean Tartuccio?"
"What power is he searching for?"
"How do you know we're rivals?"
"Invisible fog? Does that mean you can find your way through it?"
"Can you tell me where he is now?"
"Thank you."
"You actually said something that made sense."
"I see."
"And why is it you see that so clearly?"
"I don't have time to listen to an old fools nonsense. Be gone!"
"One more word — and I'll kill you".
"Get out of my sight!"
[Attack] "I warned you."
"I just do what I have to. I don't care about rivals."

{n}A jittery old man in squalid clothing shuffles up to you. His gray hair is unkempt, and he continually clenches and unclenches his wrinkled, freckled hands. When he stops and looks up at you, his eyes widen, and he tugs at his beard.{/n}

"Strange weather. Invisible fog, creeping out of the woods. Soars beyond the sky, obscures the sun and moon... Strange." {n}The old man shakes his head, his eyes shifting about seemingly at random.{/n}
{n}The old man stares at you intently.{/n} "You hasten? You should. Your rival wastes no time. He races, but in another direction. He searches for power. He'll find it."
"I see more than ever. I've never seen so much before..." {n}The old man wipes his hand across his face and sighs wearily.{/n} "But someone must look, and no one else can."
{n}The old man raises a thick eyebrow curiously.{/n} "I do nothing. Breathe? Walk? Observe?"
{n}The old man freezes for a moment.{/n} "Remus. But that won't help with the fog."
{n}The old man tugs his beard again.{/n} "He's not tall, but he wants to climb high. Beside him are those who could stand against him... and might yet still."

"Turn your back to the {g|Oleg's Trading Post}trading post{/g} and look south. There's an ancient tomb. Look for him there." {n}The old man turns and walks away slowly, muttering softly.{/n} "Once stolen, the land should be reclaimed... Once reclaimed, bound with the claimer shall it be. Bound, merged, joined by unbreakable ties. Claiming the land, claiming its pain, claiming its death..."
"I don't know — I see. You can choose where you set your eyes... usually. But can you choose what they see?"
"Someone else's. Old, but forever young. That which was taken from another. That which gave joy... and now gives death."
"The fog is... wrong. It hinders your legs, not your sight. I wish not to try."
"He's in an old tomb. South of the {g|Oleg's Trading Post}trading post{/g}."
{n}The old man shrugs.{/n} "When I see clearly, I speak clearly."
{n}The old man nods.{/n}
{n}The old man's face is blank.{/n} "I slept there last night. I noticed him as I left."

{n}The old man turns and walks away slowly, muttering softly.{/n} "Once stolen, the land should be reclaimed... Once reclaimed, bound with the claimer shall it be. Bound, merged, joined by unbreakable ties. Claiming the land, claiming its pain, claiming its death..."
"I don't like this old man. Looks like the kind who can cast the evil eye!"
"Move along, old man. We give no alms."
